TextView.android:text: Academic Qualification: PhD in Chemistry from Kansas State University.

Dr. Sanmitra Barman received his PhD in Chemistry from Kansas State University. He worked in the area of homogeneous catalysis and coordination chemistry during his doctoral work at Kansas State. He did postdoctoral research work at the University of Texas at Austin with Prof. Eric Anslyn. His research area during postdoctoral study was based on supramolecular sensing and synthetic organic chemistry. He has published several articles in international journals in the area of catalysis and sensing and has been a reviewer of many international journals in chemistry. He was a Research Scientist at the Piramal Healthcare prior to joining at BML Munjal University. At BMU, Dr. Barman has led establishment of the first year chemistry lab, including creation and of Magic of Chemistry demos during the week long first year orientation program known as Gateway to BMU. He is working with Dr. Goswami, who is supervising a student project in the Environmental Studies/Chemistry course where they’re sampling and testing discharged water in the campus.
His research interest at BMU involves designing and synthesis of nano-catalysts for various oxidation reactions. At the same time he has been involved in developing new functionalized graphene for water purification. His current interests involve projects where the undergraduates from various engineering disciplines can work in the interface of chemistry and engineering. BML Munjal University has an environment that values and promotes hands-on learning and Dr. Barman’s teaching and research experience has given him solid credentials to make a positive impact on the students. Developing new teaching methodologies for effective learning is also an area where he has been involved to a great extent.
